intro: Thymophylla pentachaeta var. puberula, commonly known as the pubescent thymophylla, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with dense, hairy foliage that helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
